channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: GAME OVER: 'Operation Endgame' Dismantles Global Cybercrime Services
item.description:
In a massive international crackdown dubbed 'Operation Endgame,' law enforcement agencies from 11 countries, coordinated by Europol, have dismantled the infrastructure of three major cybercrime-as-a-service platforms: the Rhadamanthys information stealer, the VenomRAT remote access trojan, and the E...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Incident Response

Read Full Article →

item.title: Synnovis Confirms Patient Data Stolen in Qilin Ransomware Attack on London Hospitals
item.description:
Pathology service provider Synnovis has officially confirmed that patient personal data, including names, NHS numbers, and dates of birth, was stolen during the June 2024 ransomware attack attributed to the Qilin gang. The attack caused widespread disruption to London hospitals, leading to the cance...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Retailers Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattack Tsunami, Report Warns
item.description:
A new report from managed security provider LevelBlue reveals a troubling state of cybersecurity in the retail sector. The study found that 44% of retailers have experienced a significant increase in cyberattacks, with many feeling unprepared for the next wave of AI-powered threats. Despite 45% of e...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Phishing, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Dell Patches Critical 9.1 CVSS Flaw in Data Lakehouse Platform
item.description:
Dell has released a security update to address a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-46608) in its Data Lakehouse platform, which received a CVSS score of 9.1. The flaw is an improper access control issue that could be exploited by a remote, high-privileged attacker to gain further elevated rights and ...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA KEV Alert: WatchGuard and Triofox Flaws Now Under Active Attack
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added three new vulnerabilities to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, indicating they are under active attack. The additions include CVE-2025-9242, an out-of-bounds write flaw in WatchGuard Firebox appliances, and C...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Stealthy Phishing Attack Uses HTML Smuggling & Telegram Bots to Steal Credentials
item.description:
A sophisticated phishing campaign is targeting organizations across Central and Eastern Europe, using HTML smuggling to deliver credential harvesting forms. Researchers at Cyble discovered the attack, which uses malicious HTML file attachments to bypass email security filters. Once a victim enters t...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Windows Kernel Zero-Day in November Patch Tuesday
item.description:
Microsoft's November 2025 Patch Tuesday update addresses 63 vulnerabilities, including a critical Windows Kernel privilege escalation zero-day (CVE-2025-62215) that is being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 7.0, allows a local attacker to gain SYSTEM-level privileg...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Advanced Threat Actor Exploits Cisco and Citrix Zero-Days in Targeted Attacks on Network Infrastructure
item.description:
Amazon's threat intelligence team has discovered an advanced threat actor actively exploiting two previously undisclosed zero-day vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Service Engine (ISE) and Citrix NetScaler Application Delivery Controllers (ADC). The vulnerabilities, now tracked as CVE-2025-20337 (Ci...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Introduces Sweeping Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Regulate MSPs and Mandate Stricter Breach Reporting
item.description:
The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Parliament, a landmark piece of legislation set to replace the 2018 NIS Regulations. This new bill significantly expands the regulatory landscape by bringing Managed Service Providers (MSPs) into scope for the first time, a m...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Asahi Breweries Crippled by Ransomware Attack, Shipments Plummet to 10% Ahead of Peak Holiday Season
item.description:
Japan's largest brewer, Asahi Group Holdings Ltd., is facing severe operational paralysis more than a month after a devastating ransomware attack. The attack disabled the company's core order and shipment management system, forcing a regression to manual processes like phone calls and faxes. As a re...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Clop Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Dartmouth College, Threatens to Leak Data
item.description:
The notorious Clop ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Dartmouth College, an Ivy League university in the U.S. On November 11, 2025, the group added the institution to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish exfiltrated data if the university does not enter ne...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iranian APT 'Ferocious Kitten' Continues to Target Dissidents With Custom MarkiRAT Surveillance Malware
item.description:
The Iranian-aligned APT group 'Ferocious Kitten' continues its long-running cyber-espionage campaign against Iranian dissidents and activists, according to new research from Picus Security. Active since at least 2015, the group uses spear-phishing emails with malicious Office documents to deploy its...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

item.title: Critical Triofox Zero-Day Actively Exploited for System-Level Access
item.description:
A critical, unauthenticated remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2025-12480) in Gladinet's Triofox file-sharing platform is being actively exploited by a threat group tracked as UNC6485. The attackers are bypassing authentication by spoofing HTTP Host headers to 'localhost', allowing them to cre...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: KONNI APT Weaponizes Google's Find Hub for Destructive Attacks
item.description:
The North Korea-linked threat group KONNI has been observed in a novel campaign targeting individuals in South Korea. The attackers use social engineering to deploy PC malware that steals Google account credentials. With these credentials, they access the victim's Google account and abuse the legiti...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Pentagon Overhauls Cyber Force Model to Boost USCYBERCOM Readiness
item.description:
The U.S. Department of War (DoW) has announced a new cyber force generation model aimed at enhancing the operational effectiveness, specialization, and lethality of forces assigned to U.S. Cyber Command (USCYBERCOM). The revised plan is designed to create a more integrated and agile cyber force by s...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Nikkei Slack Breach Exposes Data of 17,000 Users via Stolen Credentials
item.description:
Japanese media giant Nikkei Inc., owner of the Financial Times, has disclosed a significant data breach affecting its internal Slack workspace. An attacker gained access using authentication credentials stolen from an employee's personal computer, which was infected with infostealer malware. The inc...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Hyundai IT Affiliate Discloses Major Data Breach Exposing PII and SSNs
item.description:
Hyundai AutoEver America, the IT services subsidiary of the Hyundai Group, has begun notifying customers of a major data breach that occurred between late February and early March 2025. The incident involved unauthorized access to the company's IT environment, exposing highly sensitive personally id...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Other

item.title: China's Cyber Arsenal Exposed: Knownsec Breach Leaks State Hacking Tools and Global Target Lists
item.description:
A monumental data breach at Knownsec, a prominent Chinese cybersecurity firm with close government ties, has resulted in the exposure of over 12,000 classified documents. The leak, which occurred in early November 2025, provides an unprecedented view into China's offensive cyber capabilities, reveal...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

item.title: Swedish IT Supplier Breach Exposes Personal Data of 1.5 Million Citizens
item.description:
The 'Datacarry' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a major cyberattack on Miljödata, a Swedish IT supplier for local governments, exposing the sensitive personal data of up to 1.5 million people. The attack, which occurred in August 2025, targeted the company's HR systems, leading to th...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: EU Governments Under Siege: ENISA Reports Massive Surge in DDoS and Data Attacks
item.description:
A new threat landscape report from the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA) reveals that public administrations across the European Union are facing a dramatic increase in cyberattacks. DDoS attacks, largely driven by pro-Russia hacktivist groups like NoName057(16), account for 60% of all incidents, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: It's Official: DoD Begins Phased Rollout of CMMC Cybersecurity Program
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) has officially started the phased, three-year implementation of its Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) program as of November 10, 2025. DoD contracting officers can now begin inserting CMMC requirements into new solicitations for the Defense Indust...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: OWASP Top 10 for 2025 Released, Spotlighting Supply Chain and Design Flaws
item.description:
The OWASP Foundation has released the 2025 release candidate for its influential Top 10 list of web application security risks. This update signals a major shift in focus, with the introduction of new categories like 'A03: Software Supply Chain Failures' and 'A10: Mishandling of Exceptional Conditio...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Akira Ransomware Hits US Manufacturer Koch & Co., Threatens to Leak 54GB of Data
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group has added U.S. manufacturer Koch & Co., Inc. to its list of victims. In a November 7 post on its dark web leak site, the group claimed to have stolen 54 gigabytes of sensitive corporate data, including detailed financials, contracts, and HR files. Akira is threatening to p...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: OSCE Guide Urges Unified Cyber-Physical Defense for Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) has published a new technical guide advising governments and operators to adopt a unified approach to securing critical infrastructure. The guide emphasizes the growing convergence of physical and cybersecurity domains, warning that silo...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance, Security Operations
